verifiedData.claim: Zendesk’s plans with AI features start with the Suite Team plan at $69/agent/month (billed annually).
verifiedData.question: Zendesk Suite Team plan pricing
verifiedData.answer:
In 2025, Zendesk’s AI pricing follows a multi-layered structure composed of base subscription fees, specialized add-ons, and usage-based charges for automated resolutions.

All AI features require an underlying Zendesk Suite or Support plan, billed per agent. Suite plans include "Essential" AI agents as standard.

Note: Monthly billing is available at a higher rate (e.g., $69 for Suite Team).

To access advanced features like intelligent triage, sentiment analysis, and agent copilots, you must purchase additional packages on top of a Suite Professional or higher plan.

Zendesk has shifted toward an outcome-based pricing model for its AI agents. While plans include a small baseline of "Automated Resolutions" (ARs) per agent, excess usage is billed separately.

verifiedData.claim: Intercom is a premium, AI-first conversational platform known for its powerful chatbot, Fin, which is built on OpenAI's GPT-4.
verifiedData.question: Intercom Fin chatbot built on GPT-4
verifiedData.answer:
Intercom's Fin AI chatbot is an advanced, conversational AI agent designed to automatically resolve customer support queries using a company's knowledge base and data sources. It is priced per resolution and requires a base subscription to an Intercom plan or a standalone Fin plan.

Fin AI Agent acts as an automated front-line support representative, capable of understanding context, answering complex questions, and performing actions (like checking order status via data connectors). Key features include:

The pricing for Fin AI is a two-part model: a base plan cost plus a usage-based fee for each resolution.

This per-resolution model can lead to unpredictable monthly costs, as your bill fluctuates with customer support volume.

Intercom's pricing model is distinct from many competitors who offer flat-rate or per-agent pricing, making direct comparisons complex.

In general, Intercom's $0.99 per-resolution fee can result in significant, unpredictable expenses for businesses with high support volume, while alternatives may offer more cost-effective, predictable flat-rate options.

verifiedData.claim: eesel AI offers transparent, predictable pricing based on AI interactions, not per-resolution fees. Plans start with the Team tier at $299/month for up to 1,000 monthly interactions.
verifiedData.question: eesel AI pricing Team plan
verifiedData.answer:
eesel AI uses a predictable, flat-fee, usage-based pricing model that charges based on the number of monthly "AI interactions," not per agent or per resolution. The Team plan is designed for small teams starting with AI and costs $299 per month (or $239 per month when billed annually).

Instead of variable costs or add-ons, eesel AI provides a set pool of monthly AI interactions for a flat rate, ensuring predictable budgeting. An "interaction" is defined as each AI response from a bot, including actions like looking up information or tagging a ticket.

The main plans are:

The Team plan is priced at $299/month monthly, or $239/month with annual billing, and is best for teams looking for a Copilot solution trained on their existing documentation.

Key features of the Team plan include:

The Team plan does not include advanced features such as training the AI on past support tickets, automatic replies to tickets (AI Agent), or advanced triaging actions. These are available in the higher-tier Business or Custom plans.
